UserData.documentation: Botocore models this as a plain AttributeValue, which is inconsistent with other UserData references in the model (as well as the actual AWS behavior).

RunInstancesUserData.documentation: Botocore models this as a `string` type, but has a dedicated handler to ensure it is always base64-encoded before sending to the server. Moto sets it to a `blob` type here to ensure that it will always be base64-decoded when parsing.
